summary.p:
The manuscript contains a Tamil syllabary (U2). We find successively:
the series of initial vowels (f1).
the series of the 18 consonants with a vocalisation: ka, ṅa, ca, ña, ṭa, ṇa, ta, na, pa, ma, ya, ra, la, va, ḻa, ḷa, ṟa, and ṉa (f2).
the series of the 18 consonants, given successively (1 folio per consonant), each with the different options for the vocalisation of the consonant and, as final sign, the consonant with puḷḷi (f3–f20).

The manuscript has been used. The original Tamil foliation has been “translated” in Arabic foliation. Furthermore, the same hand has supplied, below the Tamil letters, Roman transcriptions in ink (with indication of the length of the vowels). This was done most probably by/for a French speaker, as shown, e.g., in the ka series (f3r), where ka, kā, ki, and kī are transcribed as că, cā, quĭ, quī. This later hand also added commas between the individual letters as the alphabet is given in scriptio continua.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2019 and November 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

extent.note: The leaves are broader in their middle than at their edges.

support.p: The leaves are not particularly well prepared.

collation.desc: 20 folios = syllabary. Tamil foliation 1‒20. Later added Arabic foliation 1‒20. 1 line per page (very big letters).
1 folio = guard leaf. Later added Arabic foliation 21.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1835 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1835 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
